subject: Writing
title: The Streisand Effect on Books
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Streisand Effect on Books.

hook.text: When a Florida school district banned a graphic novel about the Holocaust, it shot to number one on Amazon.

buildup.text: Art Spiegelman's Maus was removed from a Tennessee curriculum in 2022 for nudity and profanity.

discovery.text: Sales surged 753% in a single week. Bookstores couldn't keep it in stock. The ban made it a bestseller.

twist.text: This pattern repeats endlessly â€” banning a book is the most effective marketing strategy ever invented.

climax.text: The Streisand Effect shows that trying to suppress information often amplifies it far beyond the original audience.

punchline.text: Want a book to go viral? Try to ban it.

quiz.question: What happened to sales of Maus after it was banned?
